point_in_circle: When using this function, you define a circular area and GameMaker Studio 2 will work out whether the given point falls within its bounds or not. If the point falls within the defined circle the function will return <tt>true</tt> otherwise the function will return <tt>false</tt>.
The x coordinate of the point to check.
The y coordinate of the point to check.
The x coordinate of the circle centre.
The y coordinate of the circle centre.

{ANY_CODE} if point_in_circle(mouse_x, mouse_y, x, y, 16)
{nbsp_x3}{
{nbsp_x3}over = true;
{nbsp_x3}}
else
{nbsp_x3}{
{nbsp_x3}over = false;
{nbsp_x3}}

The above code uses the <tt>point_in_circle</tt> function to check if the mouse position falls within the defined circular area, setting the variable "over" to <tt>true</tt> if it does, or <tt>false</tt> otherwise.
